title: Introduction to mypdf1
text: objective package facilitate producing reports using Rmarkdown, functions type “always use, always create”.

title: Introduction to mypdf1
text: main function mypdf1, can make tables HTML latex format, main idea provide minimal parameters create table, just need provide data.frame.  can see parameters df, can put title table using title Title! value format automatically determined function called within knitr document, section, default format html, want change just use argument format possibles values html latex. want code generates table can use argument code. can choose want rows separating cells table (LaTeX version), using tabs = TRUE
code: df = Orange |>    dplyr::group_by(Tree) |>    dplyr::count()        mypdf1::pdf1_tbl(df) df |>    mypdf1::pdf1_tbl(title = "My Title!", full_page = F) df |>    mypdf1::pdf1_tbl(title = "My Title!", code = T, format = "latex")

title: Introduction to mypdf1
text: function creates frequency table, need supply data.frame variable make table. want generate table using output, just combine pdf1_tbl  can order output using sort_by, two options: absolute_frequency relative_frequency. want decreasing order put desc = T
code: infert |>    mypdf1::pdf1_freq_tbl(education) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   education absolute_frequency relative_frequency #>   <chr>                  <int>              <dbl> #> 1 0-5yrs                    12             0.0484 #> 2 6-11yrs                  120             0.484  #> 3 12+ yrs                  116             0.468  #> 4 Total                    248             1 infert |>    mypdf1::pdf1_freq_tbl(education) |>    mypdf1::pdf1_tbl() chickwts |>    mypdf1::pdf1_freq_tbl(feed, sort_by = absolute_frequency) #> # A tibble: 7 × 3 #>   feed      absolute_frequency relative_frequency #>   <chr>                  <int>              <dbl> #> 1 horsebean                 10              0.141 #> 2 meatmeal                  11              0.155 #> 3 casein                    12              0.169 #> 4 linseed                   12              0.169 #> 5 sunflower                 12              0.169 #> 6 soybean                   14              0.197 #> 7 Total                     71              1.00 chickwts |>    mypdf1::pdf1_freq_tbl(feed, desc = T, sort_by = relative_frequency) #> # A tibble: 7 × 3 #>   feed      absolute_frequency relative_frequency #>   <chr>                  <int>              <dbl> #> 1 soybean                   14              0.197 #> 2 casein                    12              0.169 #> 3 linseed                   12              0.169 #> 4 sunflower                 12              0.169 #> 5 meatmeal                  11              0.155 #> 6 horsebean                 10              0.141 #> 7 Total                     71              1.00

title: Introduction to mypdf1
text: function makes cross tables, like functions mypdf1 need supply data.frame, case two variables.  second variable (var2) top table, want marginal row table use marg = TRUE.
code: infert |>    mypdf1::pdf1_cross_tbl(education, spontaneous) infert |>    mypdf1::pdf1_cross_tbl(education, spontaneous, marg = T)

title: Introduction to mypdf1
text: base R function summary, output default data.frame, pdf1_summary enhancement function summarize data frames. ’ve probably noticed, output tibble, can combine pdf1_tbl Summary mtcars

title: Authors and Citation
text: Alisson Rosa. Maintainer.

code: @Manual{,   title = {mypdf1: mypdf1},   author = {Alisson Rosa},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.7}, }

title: mypdf1
text: can consult documentation

title: mypdf1
text: Whenever created file Rmarkdown, pattern necessary packages functions almost always used. package provides template pdf reports Rmarkdown quite usual functions, note package aggregator creator.

title: mypdf1
code: devtools::install_github("https://github.com/AlissonRP/mypdf1") remotes::install_github("https://github.com/AlissonRP/mypdf1")

title: mypdf1
text: generate pdf Rmarkdown recommended use tinytex. don’t , use:
code: tinytex::install_tinytex()

title: mypdf1
code: rmarkdown::draft("namefile.Rmd", template = "pdf1", package = "mypdf1")

title: mypdf1
code: rmarkdown::draft("namefile.Rmd", template = "pdf1-paper", package = "mypdf1", create_dir = FALSE)

title: mypdf1
text: pdf1_tbl: function used generate tables pdf1_freq_tbl: function assists creating frequency tables (tibble) pdf1_cross_tbl: 2x2 table, values can absolute marginal rows using argument marg = TRUE pdf1_summary: Summarize data.frame outputting tibble

title: pdf1_cross_tbl — pdf1_cross_tbl
text: function makes cross tables, like functions mypdf1 need supply data.frame, case two variables.

title: pdf1_cross_tbl — pdf1_cross_tbl
code: pdf1_cross_tbl(obj, var1, var2, title = "", marg = F)

title: pdf1_cross_tbl — pdf1_cross_tbl
text: obj Object used create table. Data frame, list environment (object coercible .data.frame data frame) var1 Variable want table (written string format) var2 Variable want top table (written string format) title title table, write string format marg Marginal row table, default FALSE

title: pdf1_cross_tbl — pdf1_cross_tbl
text: knitr_kable 2x2 table fitted

title: pdf1_cross_tbl — pdf1_cross_tbl
code:
mtcars |> mypdf1::pdf1_cross_tbl(cyl, am, "title", marg = TRUE) #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
title
am
cyl 0 1
4 0.2727273 0.7272727
6 0.5714286 0.4285714
8 0.8571429 0.1428571

title: pdf1_freq_tbl — pdf1_freq_tbl
text: function creates frequency table, need supply data.frame variable make table.

title: pdf1_freq_tbl — pdf1_freq_tbl
code: pdf1_freq_tbl(   obj,   var,   sort_by = {      {          var      }  },   desc = F )

title: pdf1_freq_tbl — pdf1_freq_tbl
text: obj Object used create table. Data frame, list environment (object coercible .data.frame data frame) var Variable want table (written string format) sort_by Variable want sort tibble desc want decreasing order put FALSE

title: pdf1_freq_tbl — pdf1_freq_tbl
text: tibble 4 rows 3 columns

title: pdf1_freq_tbl — pdf1_freq_tbl
text: default sort_by alphabetical order {{ var }}

title: pdf1_freq_tbl — pdf1_freq_tbl
code:
iris %>% mypdf1::pdf1_freq_tbl(Species) %>% mypdf1::pdf1_tbl("You can combine this function too!") #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
You can combine this function too!
Species absolute_frequency relative_frequency
setosa 50 0.3333
versicolor 50 0.3333
virginica 50 0.3333
Total 150 0.9999

title: pdf1_na — pdf1_na
text: function counts number NA variable data.frame

title: pdf1_na — pdf1_na
code: pdf1_na(obj, ...)

title: pdf1_na — pdf1_na
text: obj Object used create table. data.frame, list environment (object coercible .data.frame data.frame) ... arguments

title: pdf1_na — pdf1_na
text: tibble n rows n equal ncol(obj) 2 columns

title: pdf1_na — pdf1_na
code: airquality %>%   mypdf1:::pdf1_na() #> Warning: `pdf1_na()` was deprecated in mypdf1 0.6. #> Use pdf1_summary instead #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   variable na_count #>   <chr>       <dbl> #> 1 Ozone          37 #> 2 Solar.R         7 #> 3 Wind            0 #> 4 Temp            0 #> 5 Month           0 #> 6 Day             0

title: pdf1_summary() — pdf1_summary
text: base R function summary, output default data.frame, pdf1_summary enhancement function summarize data frames.

title: pdf1_summary() — pdf1_summary
code: pdf1_summary(obj, na_rm = TRUE)

title: pdf1_summary() — pdf1_summary
text: obj Object used create table. data.frame, list environment (object coercible .data.frame data.frame) na_rm option remove NA variables

title: pdf1_summary() — pdf1_summary
text: tibble n rows n equal ncol(obj)  columns summary metrics

title: pdf1_summary() — pdf1_summary
code: mtcars |>   mypdf1::pdf1_summary() #> # A tibble: 11 × 7 #>    variable    mean median      sd   min    max na_count #>    <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1 mpg       20.1    19.2    6.03  10.4   33.9         0 #>  2 cyl        6.19    6      1.79   4      8           0 #>  3 disp     231.    196.   124.    71.1  472           0 #>  4 hp       147.    123     68.6   52    335           0 #>  5 drat       3.60    3.70   0.535  2.76   4.93        0 #>  6 wt         3.22    3.32   0.978  1.51   5.42        0 #>  7 qsec      17.8    17.7    1.79  14.5   22.9         0 #>  8 vs         0.438   0      0.504  0      1           0 #>  9 am         0.406   0      0.499  0      1           0 #> 10 gear       3.69    4      0.738  3      5           0 #> 11 carb       2.81    2      1.62   1      8           0  airquality |> mypdf1::pdf1_summary(na_rm = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   variable  mean median    sd   min   max na_count #>   <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Ozone    NA      NA   NA     NA    NA         37 #> 2 Solar.R  NA      NA   NA     NA    NA          7 #> 3 Wind      9.96    9.7  3.52   1.7  20.7        0 #> 4 Temp     77.9    79    9.46  56    97          0 #> 5 Month     6.99    7    1.42   5     9          0 #> 6 Day      15.8    16    8.86   1    31          0  iris |> mypdf1::pdf1_summary() #> Warning: string and factors variables were removed for calculations #> # A tibble: 4 × 7 #>   variable      mean median    sd   min   max na_count #>   <chr>        <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Sepal.Length  5.84   5.8  0.828   4.3   7.9        0 #> 2 Sepal.Width   3.06   3    0.436   2     4.4        0 #> 3 Petal.Length  3.76   4.35 1.76    1     6.9        0 #> 4 Petal.Width   1.20   1.3  0.762   0.1   2.5        0

title: pdf1_tbl — pdf1_tbl
text: primary function mypdf1, can make tables HTML LaTeX format, main idea provide minimal parameters create table, necessarily need provide data.frame

title: pdf1_tbl — pdf1_tbl
code: pdf1_tbl(   obj,   title = "",   format = NULL,   code = F,   tabs = F,   full_page = T,   ... )

title: pdf1_tbl — pdf1_tbl
text: obj Object used create table. data.frame, list environment (object coercible .data.frame data.frame) title Title table, write string format format Format table, write string format. Possible values "latex", "html". code want table code appear console, put code = TRUE, can combine format. tabs want row separator inside table, put tabs = FALSE. full_page want table take full width page, put full_page = FALSE. ... arguments

title: pdf1_tbl — pdf1_tbl
text: object input format knitr_kable

title: pdf1_tbl — pdf1_tbl
text: Remember default format "html" default code FALSE default tabs TRUE default full_page TRUE value  format  automatically determined function called within knitr document

title: pdf1_tbl — pdf1_tbl
code:
iris %>% dplyr::group_by(Species) %>% dplyr::summarise(mean = mean(Sepal.Length)) %>% mypdf1::pdf1_tbl("THIS FUNCTION IS SO INCREDIBLE!") #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
THIS FUNCTION IS SO INCREDIBLE!
Species mean
setosa 5.006
versicolor 5.936
virginica 6.588
mtcars |> dplyr::group_by(carb) |> dplyr::summarise(sd = sd(wt)) |> mypdf1::pdf1_tbl() #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
